tool_description: Netflix, Prime, Disney, HBO, Hulu and many others. Lookup which shows are available on streaming services across 60 countries
name: Streaming Availability
title: Streaming Availability

api_list.name: Countries
api_list.description: Get all the supported countries and the list of the supported services and their details for each country. Details of services include names, logos, supported streaming types (subscription, rent, buy, free etc.) and list of available addons/channels.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com/countries"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com/countries"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

result.description: Map of country code to country details.

services.description: Map of service id to details of the service in this country.

homePage.description: Link to the homepage of the addon.

themeColorCode.description: Associated theme color hex code of the service.

lightThemeImage.description: Link to the logo of the service suitable for light themed background.

darkThemeImage.description: Link to the logo of the service suitable for dark themed background.

whiteImage.description: Link to the logo of the service that is all white.

supportedStreamingTypes.description: Details about the supported streaming types for a service-country combo.

free.description: Whether there are free shows available.

subscription.description: Whether signing up for a subscription plan is available.

addons.description: Map of id to details of the addons supported by the service in this country.

homePage.description: Link to the homepage of the addon.

themeColorCode.description: Associated theme color hex code of the addon.

image.description: Link to the logo of the addon.

api_list.name: Search by Filters
api_list.description: Search through the catalog of the given streaming services in the given country. Provides filters such as show language, genre, keyword and release year. Items per page is `25`. Can pass up to `16` services in the `services` parameter Output includes all the information about the shows, such as title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, release year, link to shows' pages in streaming services (including individual season/episode links), available subtitles, audios, available video quality and many more! Apart from the info about the given country-service combinations, output also includes information about streaming availability in the other services for the given country.

required_parameters.name: services
required_parameters.description:
A comma separated list of up to services to search in. See `/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.
Maximum amount of services allowed depends on the endpoint.
If a service supports both `free` and `subscription`, then results included under `subscription` will always include the `free` shows as well.
When multiple values are passed as a comma separated list, any show that satisfies at least one of the values will be included in the result.
Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:
- `<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of that service, including (if applicable) rentable, buyable shows or shows available through addons i.e. `netflix`, `prime`, `apple`
- `<sevice_id>.<streaming_type>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given streaming type. Valid streaming type values are `subscription`, `free`, `rent`, `buy` and `addon` i.e. `peacock.free` only returns the shows on Peacock that are free to watch, `prime.subscription` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are available to watch with a Prime subscription. `hulu.addon` only returns the shows on Hulu that are available via an addon, `prime.rent` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are rentable.
- `<sevice_id>.addon.<addon_id>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given addon. Check `/services` endpoint to fetch the available addons for a service. Some sample values are: `hulu.addon.hbo`, `prime.addon.hbomaxus`.

optional_parameters.name: keyword
optional_parameters.description: A keyword to only search within the shows have that keyword in their overview or title.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit into the returned list. If it is set as `true`, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with the same parameters for other fields such as `services` etc.), and set the `cursor` parameter as the `nextCursor` value of the previous request response. Do not forget to escape the `cursor` value before putting it into a query as it might contain characters such as `?`and `&`.
The first request naturally does not require a `cursor` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1) code of the output language. Determines in which language the output field `title` will be in. It also effects how the keyword input will be handled in search endpoints. (i.e. if `output_language` is `es`, then the `keyword` will be treated as a Spanish word).

optional_parameters.name: year_max
optional_parameters.description: Maximum release/air year of the shows.

optional_parameters.name: order_by
optional_parameters.description: Determines the ordering of the results.

optional_parameters.name: genres
optional_parameters.description: A comma seperated list of genre ids to only search within the shows in those genre. See `/genres` endpoint to see the available genres and their ids. Use `genres_relation` parameter to specify between returning shows that have at least one of the given genres or returning shows that have all of the given genres.

optional_parameters.name: genres_relation
optional_parameters.description:
Only used when there are multiple genres supplied in `genres` parameter.
When `or`, the endpoint returns any show that has at least one of the given genres. When `and`, it only returns the shows that have all of the given genres.

optional_parameters.name: year_min
optional_parameters.description: Minimum release/air year of the shows.

optional_parameters.name: show_original_language
optional_parameters.description: [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1) language code to only search within the shows whose original language matches with the provided language.

optional_parameters.name: desc
optional_parameters.description: The results are ordered in descending order if set true.

optional_parameters.name: show_type
optional_parameters.description: Type of shows to search in.

result.description: Array of the results matched with the query.

year.description: The year that the movie was released.

firstAirYear.description: The first year that the series aired.

lastAirYear.description: The last year that the series aired.

genres.description: Array of the genres associated with the show.

directors.description: Array of the directors of the movie.

creators.description: Array of the creators of the series.

status.description: The current status of a series.

statusCode.description: Integer code of the status. 1: "Returning Series", 2: "Planned", 3: "In Production", 4: "Ended", 5: "Cancelled", 6: "Pilot",

seasonCount.description: Number of seasons that are either available or announced.

episodeCount.description: Number of episodes that are either available or announced.

streamingInfo.description: Country to streaming availability info mapping of a show.

firstAirYear.description: The first year that the season aired.

lastAirYear.description: The last year that the season aired.

streamingInfo.description: Country to streaming availability info mapping of a show.

episodes.description: Array of the episodes belong to the season.

hasMore.description: Whether there are more results to be loaded.

nextCursor.description: Cursor value to pass to get next set of the results. An empty string if `hasMore` is `false`.

api_list.name: Leaving
api_list.description:
Query for the leaving movies/series/seasons/episodes in a given list of streaming services. Results are ordered by the last day to watch. Changes listed per page is `25` when `target_type` is `show`, `movie` or `series`; `50` when it is `season`; and `100` when it is `episode`.
Note that upcoming changes for the same show are aggregated together into a single `upcomingChanges` array for that show. Which means there might be cases where the count of the items in the result array might be fewer than the maximum upcoming changes listed per page. (i.e. When `target_type` is `season`, there might be 10 items in the result array, but the overall total number of upcoming changes listed across the `upcomingChanges` arrays will be still 50, given that there are at least 50 upcoming changes matches with the given query.)

required_parameters.name: target_type
required_parameters.description: Type of items to search in.

required_parameters.name: services
required_parameters.description:
A comma separated list of up to services to search in. See `/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.
Maximum amount of services allowed depends on the endpoint.
If a service supports both `free` and `subscription`, then results included under `subscription` will always include the `free` shows as well.
When multiple values are passed as a comma separated list, any show that satisfies at least one of the values will be included in the result.
Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:
- `<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of that service, including (if applicable) rentable, buyable shows or shows available through addons i.e. `netflix`, `prime`, `apple`
- `<sevice_id>.<streaming_type>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given streaming type. Valid streaming type values are `subscription`, `free`, `rent`, `buy` and `addon` i.e. `peacock.free` only returns the shows on Peacock that are free to watch, `prime.subscription` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are available to watch with a Prime subscription. `hulu.addon` only returns the shows on Hulu that are available via an addon, `prime.rent` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are rentable.
- `<sevice_id>.addon.<addon_id>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given addon. Check `/services` endpoint to fetch the available addons for a service. Some sample values are: `hulu.addon.hbo`, `prime.addon.hbomaxus`.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1) code of the output language. Determines in which language the output field `title` will be in. It also effects how the keyword input will be handled in search endpoints. (i.e. if `output_language` is `es`, then the `keyword` will be treated as a Spanish word).

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit into the returned list. If it is set as `true`, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with the same parameters for other fields such as `services` etc.), and set the `cursor` parameter as the `nextCursor` value of the previous request response. Do not forget to escape the `cursor` value before putting it into a query as it might contain characters such as `?`and `&`.
The first request naturally does not require a `cursor` parameter.

result.description: Array of the results matched with the query.

items.description: A past or upcoming change in a catalog.

season.description: Season number. Omitted if `target_type` is not `season`or `episode`.

episode.description: Episode number. Omitted if `target_type` is not `episode`.

addon.description: Addon id, if the `streamingType` is `addon`. Otherwise omitted.

year.description: The year that the movie was released.

firstAirYear.description: The first year that the series aired.

lastAirYear.description: The last year that the series aired.

genres.description: Array of the genres associated with the show.

directors.description: Array of the directors of the movie.

creators.description: Array of the creators of the series.

status.description: The current status of a series.

statusCode.description: Integer code of the status. 1: "Returning Series", 2: "Planned", 3: "In Production", 4: "Ended", 5: "Cancelled", 6: "Pilot",

seasonCount.description: Number of seasons that are either available or announced.

episodeCount.description: Number of episodes that are either available or announced.

streamingInfo.description: Country to streaming availability info mapping of a show.

firstAirYear.description: The first year that the season aired.

lastAirYear.description: The last year that the season aired.

streamingInfo.description: Country to streaming availability info mapping of a show.

episodes.description: Array of the episodes belong to the season.

hasMore.description: Whether there are more results to be loaded.

nextCursor.description: Cursor value to pass to get next set of the results. An empty string if `hasMore` is `false`.

api_list.name: Get by Id
api_list.description: Get the details of a show via IMDb or TMDb id, including the global streaming availability info.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1) code of the output language. Determines in which language the output field `title` will be in. It also effects how the keyword input will be handled in search endpoints. (i.e. if `output_language` is `es`, then the `keyword` will be treated as a Spanish word).

optional_parameters.name: imdb_id
optional_parameters.description: IMDb ID of the target show. Either this or `tmdb_id` parameter must be supplied.

optional_parameters.name: tmdb_id
optional_parameters.description: TMDb ID of the target show. Either this or `imdb_id` parameter must be supplied

api_list.name: Search by Title
api_list.description:
Search for movies and series by a title. Maximum amount of items returned are `25` unless there are more than 25 shows with the exact given title input. In that case all the items have 100% match with the title will be returned.
No pagination is supported.

optional_parameters.name: show_type
optional_parameters.description: Type of shows to search in.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1) code of the output language. Determines in which language the output field `title` will be in. It also effects how the keyword input will be handled in search endpoints. (i.e. if `output_language` is `es`, then the `keyword` will be treated as a Spanish word).

result.description: Array of the shows matched with the title.

year.description: The year that the movie was released.

firstAirYear.description: The first year that the series aired.

lastAirYear.description: The last year that the series aired.

genres.description: Array of the genres associated with the show.

directors.description: Array of the directors of the movie.

creators.description: Array of the creators of the series.

status.description: The current status of a series.

statusCode.description: Integer code of the status. 1: "Returning Series", 2: "Planned", 3: "In Production", 4: "Ended", 5: "Cancelled", 6: "Pilot",

seasonCount.description: Number of seasons that are either available or announced.

episodeCount.description: Number of episodes that are either available or announced.

streamingInfo.description: Country to streaming availability info mapping of a show.

firstAirYear.description: The first year that the season aired.

lastAirYear.description: The last year that the season aired.

streamingInfo.description: Country to streaming availability info mapping of a show.

episodes.description: Array of the episodes belong to the season.

api_list.name: Changes
api_list.description:
Query the new, removed or updated movies/series/seasons/episodes in a given list of streaming services. Results are ordered by the date of the changes. Changes listed per page is `25` when `target_type` is `show`, `movie` or `series`; `50` when it is `season`; and `100` when it is `episode`.
Note that changes for the same show are aggregated together into a single `changes` array for that show. Which means there might be cases where the count of the items in the result array might be fewer than the maximum changes listed per page. (i.e. When `target_type` is `season`, there might be 10 items in the result array, but the overall total number of changes listed across the `changes` arrays will be still 50, given that there are at least 50 changes matches with the given query.)

required_parameters.name: services
required_parameters.description:
A comma separated list of up to services to search in. See `/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.
Maximum amount of services allowed depends on the endpoint.
If a service supports both `free` and `subscription`, then results included under `subscription` will always include the `free` shows as well.
When multiple values are passed as a comma separated list, any show that satisfies at least one of the values will be included in the result.
Syntax of the values supplied in the list can be as the followings:
- `<sevice_id>`: Searches in the entire catalog of that service, including (if applicable) rentable, buyable shows or shows available through addons i.e. `netflix`, `prime`, `apple`
- `<sevice_id>.<streaming_type>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given streaming type. Valid streaming type values are `subscription`, `free`, `rent`, `buy` and `addon` i.e. `peacock.free` only returns the shows on Peacock that are free to watch, `prime.subscription` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are available to watch with a Prime subscription. `hulu.addon` only returns the shows on Hulu that are available via an addon, `prime.rent` only returns the shows on Prime Video that are rentable.
- `<sevice_id>.addon.<addon_id>`: Only returns the shows that are available in that service with the given addon. Check `/services` endpoint to fetch the available addons for a service. Some sample values are: `hulu.addon.hbo`, `prime.addon.hbomaxus`.

required_parameters.name: target_type
required_parameters.description: Type of items to search in.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit into the returned list. If it is set as `true`, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with the same parameters for other fields such as `services` etc.), and set the `cursor` parameter as the `nextCursor` value of the previous request response. Do not forget to escape the `cursor` value before putting it into a query as it might contain characters such as `?`and `&`.
The first request naturally does not require a `cursor` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: desc
optional_parameters.description: The results are ordered in descending order if set true.

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1) code of the output language. Determines in which language the output field `title` will be in. It also effects how the keyword input will be handled in search endpoints. (i.e. if `output_language` is `es`, then the `keyword` will be treated as a Spanish word).

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: [Unix Time Stamp](https://www.unixtimestamp.com/) to only query the changes since then. Must be within the past `31` days. If not supplied, the changes withing the past `15` days are returned.

episode.description: Episode number. Omitted if `target_type` is not `episode`.

addon.description: Addon id, if the `streamingType` is `addon`. Otherwise omitted.

api_list.name: Services (Deprecated)
api_list.description:
Note: This endpoint is depreacated. Use `/countries` endpoint instead.

Get all the supported streaming services, list of the supported countries for each service and other related details.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com/services"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com/services"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "streaming-availability.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

result.description: Map of service id to service details.

countries.description: Map of 2-letter country ISO code to details of the service in that country.

additionalProperties.description: Details of a service in a country.

supportedStreamingTypes.description: Details about the supported streaming types for a service-country combo.

free.description: Whether there are free shows available.

subscription.description: Whether signing up for a subscription plan is available.

addons.description: Map of id to details of the addons supported by the service in this country.

api_list.name: Genres
api_list.description: Get the ids and names of the supported genres.

print(response.json())
